programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation

Meanwhile, Data loses his head and Worf finds himself acting as midwife to Keiko. Sci-fi drama, starring Marina Sirtis, Patrick Stewart and Michael Dorn

programme.title: Biggles: Adventure In Time (1986)
programme.desc: A New York businessman is mysteriously transported back in time to the First World War, where he meets the famed British flying ace Biggles. The time traveller discovers he has been sent back to help the daredevil pilot destroy a German secret weapon that could change the course of history. Sci-fi adventure, starring Neil Dickson, Alex Hyde-White and Peter Cushing in his final film role

programme.title: Avalon: Beyond the Abyss (1999)

programme.desc: The US president's plane crashes in the Bermuda Triangle, with the head of state surviving the disaster using an escape pod. A fleet of Navy vessels is sent to recover him, only to discover the crash has awoken a terrifying monster from the ocean depths. Thriller, starring Linda Hamilton and Trevor Donovan

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: A woman faces up to a disturbing truth when she meets her double at a small-town bus terminal. Vera Miles stars

programme.title: Dracula (1958)
programme.desc: A man sent to slay a legendary vampire count becomes the bloodsucker's latest victim. Setting out in search of further prey, he stalks the family of his would-be assassin. However, a fearless doctor and expert on the supernatural is determined to bring his reign of terror to an end. Hammer horror, starring Christopher Lee, Peter Cushing and Michael Gough

programme.title: The Blob (1958)
programme.desc: A meteorite collides with the Earth and releases a virulent, flesh-eating, gelatinous monster that threatens to consume the population of a small American town. A couple of teenagers set out to warn the townsfolk of the danger they face, but nobody believes them until it is too late. Sci-fi horror, starring Steve McQueen and Aneta Corseaut. Burt Bacharach contributes the theme song

programme.title: Prince of Darkness (1988)
programme.desc: A priest discovers a mysterious canister in the cellar of his small church, and asks a group of science students to investigate the curious object. It contains a strange matter that has a terrifying supernatural effect on all who come near it - and which proves to be the essence of evil. John Carpenter's horror, starring Donald Pleasence, Jameson Parker and Victor Wong

programme.title: Resident Evil (2002)
programme.desc: A team of commandos enters a top-secret underground research facility when a deadly virus which turns victims into flesh-eating zombies is accidentally released. But their containment mission spins out of control as a rogue super-intelligent computer and hordes of the marauding undead wreak havoc. Sci-fi action horror, starring Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez and James Purefoy

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon, Tracey and Dorien manage to convince themselves Princess Diana has bought a local mansion, and enthusiastically prepare for the arrival of royal neighbours - will their attempts to raise Chigwell's social standing end in tears? Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A decomposing body in a flat leaves Stamp and Best with a baffling challenge to trace the dead man's wife - if she ever existed. Webb returns to Sun Hill and soon spots Debbie's little secret, informing the whole station of her good news. Bradford finds herself in deep trouble for passing on information that led to Samina's abduction, while Chandler panics as time starts to run out and he still can't back up his alibi

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: With the Sun Hill serial killer still at large, Lennox and Nixon are ready to pounce on any lead no matter how tenuous - so when a foul-tempered member of the public implicates his neighbour, they rush to investigate. Meanwhile, Meadows is on the horns of a dilemma - he's still determined to bring down Chandler but is equally anxious to protect the pregnant McAllister

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Chandler upsets Anne Merrick's daughter by going to the funeral and Meadows takes the opportunity to lean hard on the superintendent's unstable brother James for his version of the rape story. Best discovers physical abuse is going on in his own family, Drummond and Sharpe team up to solve a violent robbery case and a seemingly petty incident of disorderly behaviour unexpectedly throws up a new lead in the hunt for the serial killer

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As more facts emerge about the previous night's incident, solicitor Martin Porter finds himself a suspect in the serial killer investigation, despite his protestations of innocence. McAllister feels increasingly uneasy at fiance Chandler's rash decisions, and the signs look even more ominous for their future together when the superintendent's brother James is found staggering in the road, seemingly intent on being arrested

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Wingless Bird
programme.desc: Feature-length melodrama set in 1913, about the romantic relationship between Agnes Conway, whose parents own a sweetshop, and Charles Farrier, son of an altogether grander family. Agnes faces an added dilemma when she finds her heart divided between Charles and his soldier brother Reginald. Starring Claire Skinner and Edward Atterton

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The shrewd spinster is sent to convalesce in the tropical paradise of Barbados, where she finds life decidedly dull - until a grisly double murder breaks the monotony and presents her with an unforeseen opportunity to do some serious sleuthing. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, Donald Pleasence and Adrian Lukis

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: Angry artist Agatha Troy is determined to unmask the forger who is faking her paintings. Inspector Alleyn finds time to alert her to the possible danger involved in her search, but has to concentrate his detecting energies on the case of a corpse found in a tranquil spot outside the home of Percival Pyke Period. A fractious party of lunch guests provides the necessary pool of suspects. With guest stars John Gielgud, Geoffrey Palmer and Belinda Lang

programme.title: McMafia
programme.desc: Alex believes Vadim is still a threat despite Semiyon's fortunes continuing to rise - until he is arrested in Tel Aviv. This new development disrupts Alex and Rebecca's engagement celebrations, forcing Alex to fly out to Israel and try to resolve the crisis. However, Semiyon's plight presents a despairing Lyudmilla with fresh hope, and she seeks to use this opportunity to regain her freedom. Masha confesses her secret to Katya, while Rebecca grows closer to Antonio while her fiance is out of the country

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: With his friend in peril and a young woman kidnapped by the relentless serial killer, can Luther protect the innocent while preventing Cornelius's violent revenge from consuming him? Who is Luther willing to save, and who can't he bear to lose? Crime drama, starring Idris Elba and Ruth Wilson

programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: Drama from the pen of Sally Wainwright. Catherine Cawood is the sergeant on duty when accountant Kevin Weatherill enters her police station to report a crime - the kidnapping of his boss's daughter. Although he originally came up with the plan as a way of paying for his children's private education, he eventually backed out. However, his partner is dangerous local drug kingpin Ashley Cowgill - and he has gone ahead with the plot anyway. The case hits a nerve for Catherine, who has lost her own daughter and is determined to bring the captors to justice. Sarah Lancashire stars, with Steve Pemberton, Joe Armstrong, James Norton, Siobhan Finneran and George Costigan

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.desc: After the death of Ludovico's wife, Leonardo is given a new art commission. Testing his creativity and trialling a new technique, he must also deal with political unrest

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.desc: Returning to Florence, an uninspired Leonardo accepts to paint the portrait of Lisa Gherardini, that will become the Mona Lisa

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe has his hands full again, with Fisher breathing down his neck over an operation to seize stolen vehicles, and a fussy food inspector causing a stir at the restaurant. Crime drama, guest starring Phyllis Logan, with Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the first of two episodes tonight, Chandler tries to maintain an outward veneer of respectability by marrying Debbie McAllister, but reckons without the persistence of a vengeful Mickey Webb, who continues working behind the scenes to end his career. Drummond and Hunter pose as decorators to carry out a surveillance operation, and profiler David Chiu arrives at Sun Hill to help with the serial killer investigation - much to the dismay of acting DI Sam Nixon, who already has a suspect in her sights

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As Dominic tries to give Isaac's father the best treatment possible, Lofty is desperate to repair their relationship, while Ange turns to Carole in order to protect her son. When an old patient of Jac's shows up with a tempting offer, she has to decide how far she will go for personal gain

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Eddie realises Alicia is scared of him after discovering that she has swapped all her shifts to avoid him. Meanwhile, Bea receives a phone call about her dad and leaves work to pick him up from the police station, and Sam and Jacob discuss which of the ED staff she would be able to beat in a boxing match

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: What should have been the happiest moment of Debbie McAllister's life turns into a hideous nightmare when Chandler lets his mask slip, raping her on their wedding night. However, his time is rapidly running out as the Criminal Investigations Bureau start probing his career, and in desperation he acquires a firearm under false pretences and absconds with his pregnant wife - can Meadows and Webb track them down before events reach a tragic conclusion?

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil, thrown into a panic as reality sinks in, threatens Jamie. Meanwhile, Gus puts on a brave face. Will Sonia ever know what he had planned?

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Little Mo has bad news for Peggy, who is starting to crack

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Maritime drama with the Howard family, starring Maurice Colbourne and Jan Harvey

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer is arrested on suspicion of armed robbery - and to make matters worse, the only way he can clear his name is by admitting he was with a charming ex-girlfriend at the time. He must decide whether to come clean and face a jealous Charlotte's wrath, or take the consequences of the charge. Ian McShane stars

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: A freak storm disrupts village life, bringing down power lines and causing a string of accidents. Jack and Beth immediately rush out to do their bit, working round the clock to treat casualties, saving strangers as well as close friends injured in the general devastation. Amanda Burton and Kevin Whately star as the medics

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon's life appears to be in danger, with a potential assassin apparently stalking the leisure centre. However, he is far more concerned with addressing the facility's falling attendance figures. Chris Barrie stars

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth forces Richard to participate in a trip to the countryside to look for Iron Age remains, but further cultural excursions are curtailed when Daisy and Onslow report that Rose is behaving in an outrageous fashion. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: A child's kite inspires Seymour to create his own giant version, and he tries to demonstrate to those around him how simple it is to make one. Michael Aldridge and Mike Grady star in Roy Clarke's long-running comedy

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Nora Batty invites Compo up to her bedroom, but it proves to be an entirely innocent invitation as she merely wishes him to remove a mangle and deliver it to a friend. However, the nature of the item creates all sorts of problems. Long-running comedy, starring Bill Owen and Kathy Staff

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a doorkeeper at the House of Lords is murdered, Lynley and Havers believe the victim's gambling debts must have been the motive. When a clerk also dies, evidence of a wider conspiracy involving stolen papers is uncovered. The detectives locate the missing documents, but realise they are being followed and must catch the killer before someone beats them to it

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ricky Hanson faces trial for attempted murder, and his lawyer sets about trying to discredit each member of the squad. However, Jack receives a welcome distraction when an old friend asks him to reinvestigate the death of a wealthy businessman, and he, Brian and Gerry spring into action. Guest starring David Troughton, with Amanda Redman, James Bolam, Alun Armstrong and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Cutting It
programme.desc: Drama set in a Manchester hairdressing salon. Husband-and-wife owners Allie and Gavin celebrate the 10th anniversary of their business, but when empty premises across the road are purchased by a mysterious beauty, Allie is forced to confront emotions she has kept hidden for 18 years. Amanda Holden and Sarah Parish star

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Seen comes under suspicion following Kris's dramatic escape, while a seance spells trouble on G-wing when excitable Tina O'Kane tries to communicate with the spirit of her old friend Al - leading to violence. It is also the day of Di and Jim's wedding - but the chances of it going off without a hitch are slim, especially when a couple of uninvited guests turn up to throw a spanner in the works. Prison drama, starring Jack Ellis, Charlotte Lucas, Jennifer Ness and Tracey Wilkinson

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon's life appears to be in danger, with a potential assassin apparently stalking the leisure centre. However, he is far more concerned with addressing the facility's falling attendance figures. Chris Barrie stars

programme.desc: Part one of two. Crabbe leaves the restaurant behind for a day at the races, but his fun is cut short by the discovery of a stable lad's dead body. Starring Richard Griffiths, Samantha Womack, Maggie Steed and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: The Bill

programme.desc: As Dominic continues to treat Isaac's father, Lofty is determined to protect him, but when Dominic refuses to let him it puts their marriage in doubt and plays into Isaac's hands. programme.desc: With Dylan nowhere to be found, Connie and Elle are forced to work together to pitch for funding for a new trauma centre. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Chandler finally runs out of options and as a gunshot echoes around the station, Debbie is rushed into hospital in a desperate bid to save her unborn child. programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A penniless sculptor seeks the canny dealer's help to prise a considerable inheritance out of his avaricious brother. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: A Cardale schoolgirl begins behaving erratically, causing concern for her parents and provoking a professional difference of opinion between Will and Beth. While they're squabbling over the cause of her symptoms, Practice Manager Kim attends a school reunion where she meets a former teacher whose health problems give her a fresh insight into the case. Amanda Burton and Simon Shepherd star

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Following his departure to Bulgaria, news of Gordon Brittas' apparent death reaches his colleagues at Whitbury Leisure Centre. However, Brittas returns from the dead to cause havoc and Carole is determined to save her baby from his zombie. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth and Richard take over a country cottage for a couple of days, with unexpected results. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour departs for a new teaching job, leaving Clegg and Compo at a loose end now he is no longer around to drag them into his eccentric schemes. However, they do not realise an old friend is about to return to the village. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy makes an ill-advised attempt to establish long-distance communication with Compo and Clegg by investing in some walkie-talkies. However, it doesn't take long for one of the units to fall foul of a tractor. Long-running rural comedy, with Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: A brewery heiress appears to be the sole witness to the murder of a serial killer - but she was herself presumed dead 19 years previously. programme.desc: Matt's antique vibration device is sure to create a buzz in the Bidding Room. Will the bizarre Victorian medical device reach his desired price? Nigel Havers also meets Samantha and Joshua, who are hoping to sell their art deco cinema seat to fund a holiday

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Ireland (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the final match in the fourth and penultimate round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. After impressive victories over England and Wales, Scotland tasted defeat for the first time in the campaign last time out when they lost 32-21 to France in Paris. That result left Ireland as the one team still in with a chance of the Grand Slam, and they will be hopeful of emulating their 26-5 triumph over the Scots in Dublin last year. With analysis from Martin Johnson, John Barclay, and Tommy Bowe

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith discovers how cuts are affecting management of Dartmoor. She finds out how the major political parties are taking sides over to the right to camp debate, and catches up with author Guy Shrubsole to discover a rare rainforest in the UK. Matt Baker helps conservationists with a bird survey, Adam Henson visits an equine rehab centre, and Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn meets volunteers opening up Dartmoor for everyone. Plus, in the second of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles discovers what it takes to be a hill farmer in Wales

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores British woodland, grassland, freshwater and ocean habitats, revealing the surprising and dramatic wildlife that exist right on the doorstep, the existence of which is critical for the survival of species right across the globe. The first episode examines the benefits of Britain's natural geology and examines ways in which depleted islands can be restored for future generations

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Belmont House in Kent, where she encounters a disguised Michael McIntyre preparing a prank for his Saturday night show. Items brought in to be valued include an early David Hockney painting, a trophy awarded to Take That in 1995, a sword that once belonged to a member of the Dervish religious order, and a telegram announcing the end of the Second World War

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer sets up his timeshare business in Tenerife. When his passport expires, he is warned about his arrest and flees to Brazil. The police find details of a foreign bank account that has been laundering Brink's-Mat proceeds, and Boyce is sent to Switzerland on a mission to learn who controls it. McAvoy dreams up a prison escape plan, while Cooper and Parry are lured into a trap as the money is traced back to them

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from today's Premier League fixtures, including Fulham v Arsenal at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Southampton at St Mary's Stadium. The Gunners faced a test of their title credentials away to a Fulham side that have impressed this season, while United will have expected three points against the struggling Saints. Plus, Newcastle United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and West Ham United v Aston Villa

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Chelsea v Manchester United, Arsenal v Reading and Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester City

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Rugby union player Danny Cipriani, W Series World Champion Jamie Chadwick, former Sunderland striker Kevin Phillips and Commonwealth gold medal-winning weightlifter Zoe Smith join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley appeal for information from the public about crimes around the country

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In Kent, a police sergeant puts his life in danger when he rescues a man from a house fire, while in Bristol two cops wrestle an armed robber to the ground. In Oxfordshire, after being assaulted by a man he's trying to help, a paramedic has an arranged meeting with the offender

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts is buoyed up by a bijou bungalow near Bradford, before heading down to Ramsgate on the Kent coast to meet a couple who have found their dream 'forever' home. Dion Dublin finds a quirky house in Oldbury, near Birmingham, that just keeps on giving

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian presents the show from Blackpool's newest museum, while the teams are shopping nearby in an antiques centre with the help of experts Izzie Balmer and Colin Young

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ruhma tries to help some new fathers, while Suni charms the team at The Mill. Medical drama series set in a busy Midlands surgery

programme.title: A Service of Celebration for Commonwealth Day
programme.desc: The King presides over a ceremony and service at Westminster Abbey

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Philip Serrell hunt for bargains in the Lake District, taking a toy lion and a Victorian portable toilet to be sold at auction in Lancashire

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: An intrepid team of four friends competes for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Under pressure from Ravi, Denise considers breaking into Jack's laptop to get the information he needs. Jay and Lexi worry when Lola appears to zone out, but she refuses to get checked out. Freddie hits upon an idea to make cash for the struggling Slaters

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public, and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. Over the last year, Panorama has had exclusive access to Kent Police as their detectives try to catch the fraudsters. The programme explores why so few cases are prosecuted and shows how fraudsters target the vulnerable, often using sophisticated techniques to dupe victims

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Builder Garry has been learning to drive for 30 years, and relies on wife Jeany to take him everywhere. Following an accident, Garry now has to pass to help her. Garry's battle is even tougher as his dyslexia makes following signs difficult, but Jeany is there with constant advice. During their five days at Scarlett's Driving School, there are near-misses on roundabouts and marital squabbles

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Vernon gives the police a fake account of the incident, keeping Lou out of his story. He pretends to recognise her as Bill Slack's daughter, and angrily demands that she be removed, promptly suspending the interview. After he is taken into custody, Lou attempts to live a normal life within the law. But she still has to deal with suspicion from Sandy and finds herself pushed to breaking point

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: An Irish Goodbye (2022)
programme.desc: In rural Northern Ireland, two estranged brothers reunite following their mother's untimely death. Bafta-winning comedy drama, starring James Martin, Seamus O'Hara and Michelle Fairley

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: The trainees are just one step from the final, but one of them has been keeping a secret that will change everything

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The second of two compilations of highlights from the recent series. Among the guests featured are Tom Hanks, Cate Blanchett, Austin Butler, Michelle Yeoh, Hugh Jackman, Naomi Ackie, Brendan Fraser, Judi Dench, Jamie Dornan, Kate Winslet, Lizzo and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley appeal for information from the public about crimes around the country

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: An officer puts his life on the line when he tries to stop a dam from bursting and in south Wales a paramedic is assaulted on duty. Plus, armed robbers live stream a police chase

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Tommy Walsh meet the new owners of a house in Gillingham, a studio flat in London's East End and a damp-riddled semi in Stoke-on-Trent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Wrexham, North Wales, and discovers the gruesome history of St Winefride's Well. Experts Jonathan Pratt and Tim Weeks assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Luca meets Jamie's mum and Nina has an idea to help The Mill. Suni helps a student struggling to leave their old life behind

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay and his guests demonstrate how to grow potatoes, replace broken guttering, build a shoe bench and create a loft hatch

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple who are returning to the UK from Malaysia after becoming grandparents, and are keen to find a home in the Herefordshire countryside

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha and Phil continue on their antiquing adventure. While Natasha uncovers an early silver sandwich box and a Scottish spirit kettle, Phil finds a Victorian fish service

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: An intrepid team of four work colleagues competes for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, presented by Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey goes to the police station, where she denies stealing the money in the face of Callum's questioning. Ravi plans to break into the Branning house to search for the information he needs only to be interrupted by Chelsea. Denise is desperate to set Keanu and Chelsea up on another date, Alfie is shocked by Freddie's money-making scheme and Emma undoes all Jay's good work with Lola and Lexi

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The teams make over different classrooms of a children's nursery in Oxfordshire - one for babies, one for toddlers and another for three to five-year-olds. Each room must feature different areas to accommodate various activities and safety is the key, and while dominates most of their plans, one team controversially opts for a shade of beige. What will Michele Ogundehin and guest judge Sophie Robinson think of the end results?

programme.title: Emma, Oti & Rylan's Big Red Nose Day Challenge
programme.desc: Emma Willis, Oti Mabuse and Rylan attempt to climb the Cairn Gorm mountain in the Scottish Highlands to raise money for Comic Relief. Starting from Braemar, the climbers receive a heroes' send off as they head away from the historic town and the toilet facilities. Their three-day expedition does not go as smoothly as they had hoped as 80mph winds threaten to end their journey before they barely get started

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Sully - Miracle on the Hudson (2016)
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood's fact-based drama, starring Tom Hanks as pilot Chesley 'Sully' Sullenberger, who rose to fame in January 2009 when he safely landed US Airways Flight 1549 in New York's Hudson River after the plane lost all engine power shortly after take-off - an event that captured the imagination of the world. Also starring Aaron Eckhart, Laura Linney and Anna Gunn

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates are tasked with creating and branding a new dog food before pitching to major retailers. In the kitchen one team argues over the recipe for their signature dish, while on the other side a premium product fails to deliver. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar assesses their collective efforts and removes another hopeful from the process

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Stephen Mangan, Charlotte Church, Sam Quek, Nihal Arthanayake, Kate Humble, Rosie Ramsey and Keith Brymer Jones

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley shares the stories of a Muslim taxi driver driven by his faith to help his community through the pandemic, and a Jewish fire chief who is hoping to inspire others to follow in her footsteps

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Another look back at some highlights from the show, as Monty Don demonstrates how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man whose beachfront plots are at the constant mercy of the sea, and Arit Anderson meets a woman on a mission to 'green up' neglected urban spaces

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Matt Baker are on the east coast of England to find out how storms are devouring the coastline, putting homes and livelihoods at threat. Tom Heap is in East Anglia, investigating the threat to Britain's breadbasket, while Adam Henson looks into the impact of new farm payments. In the first of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles is in North Wales, finding out just what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Life in a Cottage Garden with Carol Klein
programme.desc: As spring arrives, the horticulturist clears away the last of the winter debris, sows her first seeds and calls an expert in to cloud-prune her box hedging - but work is interrupted by a nesting bird. There is a surge of lush new growth come May and Carol's seedlings need pricking out, and now the frosts are over, the renewal of the garden is once again under way

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick delves into the stories of those who worked in Cornwall's mines, from the men who laboured beneath the earth's surface to the young women who earned their living breaking rocks with heavy sledgehammers. He also visits a maker of botanical spirits, and adds a cheeky nip to his clementine trifle

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode continues his alphabetical journey, this time looking at dishes linked by the letter R. Recipes from the archive include Nigel Slater cooking ribs and Raymond Blanc creating rice pudding

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Manchester United (Kick-off 12.30pm). All the action from the top-flight encounter at Kingsmeadow. The Blues are looking to win their fourth consecutive league title, but United are very much in contention to end their run and become champions for the first time in their history

programme.title: The Third Man (1949)
programme.desc: American writer Holly Martins goes to post-Second World War Vienna at the invitation of his old friend Harry Lime, only to find he has died. However, the author finds the circumstances surrounding his death fail to add up and goes in search of the truth - but is unprepared for the ugly secrets he uncovers. Carol Reed's thriller, written by Graham Greene, starring Joseph Cotten, Orson Welles, Alida Valli and Trevor Howard

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: Ten aspiring designers compete in the makeover challenge, hoping to get their big break in the world of commercial interior design. Michelle Ogundehin asks them to transform five luxury apartments in London's Elephant and Castle and they must work in pairs, with one in charge of the open-plan kitchen-living room, while the other takes control of the bedrooms. Alan Carr hosts

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team visit Southwell Minster, near Nottingham, where experts Michael Baggott and Caroline Hawley appraise the best items on offer, including a collection of gold that raises the roof and an art deco brooch. Paul also finds time to explore Newstead Abbey, the country seat of poet and Lothario Lord Byron, and finds out that there is more to him and his relationships than meets the eye

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: The key moments from the fourth and penultimate weekend of the championship, featuring England v France, Italy v Wales and Scotland v Ireland

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Giles Coren visit the Yorkshire Dales to work at Swinton Estate, the ancestral home of Lord and Lady Masham. By taking a look the heart of the grand house and its countryside charm, as well as the wider estate, which has opened up to for guests to enjoy, Monica and Giles learn about the challenges of making history pay in the modern world

programme.title: Paul Whitehouse: Our Troubled Rivers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Paul visits the River Wye and discovers how an explosion of algae caused by fertiliser run-off from farming is part of a cocktail overwhelming the habitats along the waterway. He travels to Hampshire where he hears about the damage being caused to rare and precious chalk streams, before discovering how regular sewage discharges on the coast are causing problems for Whitstable's famous oyster industry. Ending his journey in London, Paul finds a beacon of hope in the form of the £4.4billion Thames Tideway super sewer

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: W Kamau Bell's documentary about Bill Cosby's descent from 'America's Dad' to alleged sexual predator examines how the actor and comedian's reputation evolved in the 1970s, when he became an on-screen educator and moral authority - a man thought to be trustworthy

programme.title: Mr. Jones (2019)
programme.desc: In 1933, Welsh journalist Gareth Jones travels to Moscow in the hope of interviewing Joseph Stalin, but instead escapes the city and uncovers evidence of a devastating famine in Ukraine. However, it is not just the Soviets who want word of the terrible reality suppressed. Fact-based drama, starring James Norton

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: The documentary continues with the investigation into the sinking of the Rainbow Warrior in May 1985. Just one day after the explosions that sunk the Greenpeace ship, police were overwhelmed with calls from people claiming to have spotted unusual goings on. One witness led to Swiss tourists Alain and Sophie Turenge. They came into the station voluntarily but their inability to answer simple questions led police to doubt their identities

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Upon discovering that his family has moved on in his absence, Stede vows to make things right with his wife, Mary. After a desperate attempt to stage a show for the crew, Izzy confronts a depressed Blackbeard about his former life

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Dave meets with music company executives while pitching for a record deal. He ends up being introduced to Benny Blanco and Justin Bieber, and gets invited to his first Hollywood party, where he rubs shoulders with Kourtney Kardashian.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in London to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey helps the Viney family declutter their home after grandma Sue filled their house with her deceased mum's belongings and the contents of a recently closed gift shop. Sue's children are desperate for a clear out so they can come over and spend more time with her. The team remove everything from the house including 532 plastic carrier bags, 205 hair rollers, 30 umbrellas, 17 digital cameras and 443 pairs of shoes. While the family sort through what they want to keep, recycle, donate or sell, carpenter Rob installs a pulldown bed for extra space and Dilly reinstates the downstairs as a functioning living and dining space

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley shares the stories of a man who found religion and denounced violence, and hears about a cathedral helping people back into the workplace

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team face one of their smallest but trickiest challenges in the shape of mussels. These small shellfish have blocked the pipes of a huge vessel, stalling it in dock. Now it's up to the divers to blast the mussels out of their hiding places to allow the ship to sail once more

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and Ishy Khan go treasure hunting around Derbyshire. Izzie has her sights set on a little something for the breakfast table, while Ishy has some miniature sporting equipment in mind. Away from the shops, Izzie heads to Derby to see a huge collection of Victorian toys that were the home entertainment systems of the day, as well as being a novel form of advertising aimed at theatregoers. Ishy heads to Matlock Bath, just in time to take part in a festival of lights that took its inspiration from Queen Victoria

programme.title: Winterwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham talks to David Attenborough about all things British wildlife and the series Wild Isles. Chris and Michaela Strachan also bid farewell to Wild Ken Hill, where they've been based for two years, while Iolo Williams and Gillian Burke remain on the coast for a cetacean celebration before saying goodbye to the wild badger sett they've been following all series

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how Mediterranean cuisine and ingredients have influenced British culinary culture since it was first introduced by the Romans, and prepare their favourite recipes

programme.title: Wild West: America's Great Frontier
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the history and geography of America's deserts, canyons and wilderness, exploring the lives of the people and animals that have found ways to thrive and prosper in these brutally inhospitable conditions. The first programme examines the agricultural traditions of the Hopi Native American tribe in northeastern Arizona, as well as exploring the strategies used by a variety of wildlife, including mustangs, coyotes and desert tortoises, to survive in these demanding environments

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents more memorable moments from the long-running programme. Veteran experts discuss how they developed their sales patter, while jewellery specialist John Benjamin recalls a memorable visitor to the show in Belfast

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Presenters visit food festivals across the UK, beginning with Edith Bowman and Colin Murray at the Stranraer Oyster Festival, as celebrations mark the start of the native oyster season. They sail into Loch Ryan to Scotland's largest oyster bed to discover why they're so special. Chef Julie Lin discovers bargains in the World Food aisles, and gets the lowdown on low fat, semi-skimmed and full fat milk, while farmer Jim Smith gets stuck into some sticky sweets

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox returns with the programme that celebrates the joy of books and reading, and is joined by guests Angela Scanlon, DJ Spoony, Rob Rinder and Cerys Matthews. They all bring their favourite books to champion, and review this week's book club choices of In the Blink of an Eye by Jo Callaghan, and Burial Rites by Hannah Kent

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the first semi-final as he invites four heat-winners to brave the black chair once again to answer questions on the specialist subjects of The Great Escape, Oscar-winning performances of the 1990s, the life and death of stars, and Peep Show, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell asks the questions in the final of the quiz, with two teams battling it out to succeed last year's winners the Data Wizards and be named champions. The contestants must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may at first appear not to be linked, with one set of clues asking what concludes the sequence nauru, Canada, BOlivia

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the third of the quarter-finals, two teams of four students compete to make it to the next stage of the competition as they try to win two matches and progress to the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: Facing the board in this edition are Ruben, who has been serving a sentence for biting a man's ear off, and Tom , who made close to a million pounds dealing cocaine. Mark disagrees with his sentence for threatening to kill and denies large portions of the crime that led him to prison. Will his desire to see his kids for Christmas be enough to convince the Board he deserves a second chance, or will his chequered past continue to dictate his future?

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Andy has a job interview and Lance has a lot of catching up to do, so the mystery of the buried bomber is the least of their problems. But then a disturbing possibility emerges from an unlikely source, throwing everything into doubt. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Don't Look Now (1973)
programme.desc: A couple trying to get over the death of their daughter take a trip to Venice, where they are shocked by a psychic's claim that the child is trying to contact them. Although the wife believes her story, the husband remains sceptical - until he begins to be troubled by spectral visions of his own. Nicholas Roeg's supernatural thriller based on Daphne du Maurier's short story, with Donald Sutherland and Julie Christie

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Ally takes Dave with her when she attends her sister's wedding, where she is due to give the maid of honour speech. Meanwhile, Mike is trying to finalise Dave's first record deal on the very same weekend

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Matt Baker are on the east coast of England to find out how storms are devouring the coastline, putting homes and livelihoods at threat. Tom Heap is in East Anglia, investigating the threat to Britain's breadbasket, while Adam Henson looks into the impact of new farm payments. In the first of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles is in North Wales, finding out just what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Two brothers give investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett petrol head vibes as they ride into the Den with their motorcycle clothing brand. Also hoping to rev up the Dragons desire to invest is a matcha-based energy drink company and the entrepreneur behind an inclusive nail polish brand. However, there's competition for cash from a DIY tool that promises to provide measurements like no other and a multipurpose keyring. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives blacksmith Alex and furniture-maker Cora the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. Although incredibly passionate about his craft, Alex suffers with imposter syndrome but mentor Adrian Wood is hoping to help him see the beauty in his work. Cora gave up her day job, determined to follow her dreams but dislikes the small details and often jumps to the next job before finishing the first. Mentor Alice thinks Cora has great taste and believes her best chance at making her dreams reality is to focus on the designing rather than making every piece herself

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Anish explores his connection to his Hindu faith as an openly gay man. Hoping to reconnect to his religion, he goes on a journey to see if he can reconcile his faith and sexuality. He also faces his greatest fear by revisiting the school where he experienced homophobic bullying as a teenager to speak to the current students about tolerance

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The diving team get a late call from a boat in peril. A missing lifeboat cannister means a ferry is unable to sail, causing chaos for the passengers that use the service for their daily commute. It's a needle-in-a-haystack hunt in near-zero visibility - and to make matters worse, local leisure cruisers create imminent danger for the diver underwater

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Ishy Balmer visits the first Jain temple in the western world and Izzie Khan discovers the history of folk art. Later, the final auction in Leicestershire, sees broken pineapples, legless glass ladies, mystery board games and an antique pub table - but which items will make the duo some money?

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King are in Northumberland, enjoying its stunning coastline and rugged landscapes. The duo visit Hjem, a Michelin-starred restaurant located within the Hadrian Hotel and run by Scandinavian-born chef Alex and his partner Ally, who's front of house. It's the Bikers' job to help Alex and Ally connect with new, local producers, ones that can inspire award-winning cuisine

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the fourth round of fixtures, including Leigh Leopards v St Helens, Leeds Rhinos v Wakefield Trinity and Hull FC v Salford Red Devils

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare dishes from their favourite cookery books, explaining their value as social documents that reveal a great deal about people and what they ate. The duo meet Ivan Day, who has one of the most extensive collections of recipe books in the UK, and share stories of renowned food writers such as Elizabeth David and Isabella Beeton

programme.title: Wild West: America's Great Frontier
programme.desc: Wildlife in America's mountain regions, including the Rockies and the Sierra Nevada, areas infamous for extremes of temperature from freezing winters to scorching summers. The programme examines the survival strategies employed by animals including black bears, pikas and bison, as well as parasitic plants. Plus, a look at the challenges faced by these region's human inhabitants, including ranchers leading their cattle on 70-mile journeys

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents another selection of choice moments from the long-running series. The show's specialists recall the difficulties that arose while recording episodes in Europe, and Andy McConnell remembers a glass artist with a difference

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas take part in the game show, hosted by Richard Osman

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores Abergavenny food festival in Wales, where he discovers the secrets of barbecuing success from experts Sam and Shauna. Farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles with fifth-generation pickers in Carmarthenshire and Onkar Singh Purewal, a father of toddler triplets, is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In St Agnes, the crew is involved in a race against time to rescue two young men. They are reported to be struggling in the water near a notorious headland known as Tubby's Head. In Whitby, North Yorkshire, Leah is training to be the station's first female helm, and her skills are put to the test when she is called out to rescue a walker who's fallen and injured her leg on inaccessible rocks by the seal colony at Ravenscar

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Northern Ireland serve up their canapes, starters and fish dishes on an animation and illustration theme. Their vegan starters include a celebration of mushrooms inspired by the Northern Ireland animated film Wolfwalkers and an artichoke tart playing tribute to the Gruffalo trail in Belfast. Among the fish dishes are two based on Puffin Rock - one with pan-fried cod, the other an elevated version of fish, chips and curry sauce - as well as a sea trout with buttermilk sauce celebrating the illustrations in The Fog Catcher's Daughter

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us: Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Two-part documentary in which co-presenters Rob Rinder and Sarah Agha, along with others of Jewish and Palestinian heritage, explore how their families' histories were impacted by the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. They begin by meeting a father and son who follow in the footsteps of their ancestor, who became caught up in Israel's War of Independence, and a woman whose grandmother survived one of the most notorious episodes of the Nakba

programme.title: QI XS
programme.desc: A selection of highlights from the comedy panel game, in which things just didn't go according to plan. Hosted by Sandi Toksvig, with regular panellist Alan Davies and guests

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: Facing the board in this edition are Ruben, who has been serving a sentence for biting a man's ear off, and Tom , who made close to a million pounds dealing cocaine. Mark disagrees with his sentence for threatening to kill and denies large portions of the crime that led him to prison. Will his desire to see his kids for Christmas be enough to convince the Board he deserves a second chance, or will his chequered past continue to dictate his future?

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Having just signed his first record deal, Dave fights to push his own creative vision - in this case, a brand new and controversial track called Jail, which he has earmarked as his first ever release but which his record company strongly objects to

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: While making a video he hopes will propel him to global success, Dave is forced to face reality as the project threatens to implode. Comedy about a neurotic suburbanite convinced he is destined to be a rap star, starring Dave Burd, with GaTa and Andrew Santino

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses the south east of Australia from Canberra, the seat of government, to the multi-ethnic heart of its second largest city, Melbourne. Floating above Canberra in a hot-air balloon, Michael sees how Australia's 'Bush Capital' was planned in the early 20th century and tours the nation's Parliament. He takes the high-speed train nearly 300 miles south west, to arrive in Melbourne at the head of Port Philip Bay on Australia's south-eastern coast

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford report on the holiday makers who arrived at their hotels only to discover they'd been closed for years

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives jeweller Annelies and woodturner Lucinda the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. After investing £7,000 into setting up her jewellery business, Annelies from Glasgow needs help on bringing that money back and making a profit. Lucinda spends what little free time she has in her garage turning wood into make-up brushes. Mentors Barnaby and Dru see huge potential in her but will her first market be a success?

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Come Dancing
programme.desc: Terry Wogan introduces another edition of the inter-regional dance contest from 1977, which sees the North East compete against the North West at Tiffany's Ballroom, Glasgow. Barri Haynes provides the commentary

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: Pianist Martha Argerich performs a piece by Schubert with conductor Daniel Barenboim in an extract from the 2016 Proms. Presented by Katie Derham and Samira Ahmed

programme.title: The Classical Collection
programme.desc: The natural world has always been a powerful inspiration to composers. From vast forests and tiny fish to wild storms and epic seascapes, this programme takes viewers on an evocative journey through some of the best-loved musical responses to the living planet. Including works by Vivaldi, Reiner, Vaughan Williams and Debussy

programme.title: Tartuffe
programme.desc: The Birmingham Rep's production of Molière's comedy Tartuffe, updated to the West Midlands, telling the story of a wealthy merchant who makes the mistake of extending the hand of hospitality toward a swindler and hypocrite - with disastrous consequences for his family. Originally staged by the Royal Shakespeare Company, and adapted by Anil Gupta and Richard Pinto, the Bafta-winning duo behind Citizen Khan and Goodness Gracious Me

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Miami
programme.desc: Clive sets out to discover the truth about an American city that was seen as the vice capital of America, teeming with money, illegal aliens and cocaine. He investigates what is beneath the surface, meeting famous resdients in Miami Vice star Don Johnson and singer Gloria Estefan

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary examining how the National Enquirer became the most infamous tabloid in America by churning out obscene stories that blur the lines between truth and fiction

programme.title: Africa with Ade Adepitan
programme.desc: Ade explores Tanzania, Ethiopia, and Somalia, visiting a game reserve where efforts are being made to halt the decline of elephant numbers. He tours Addis Ababa with former Olympic champion Haile Gebrselassie to discover why Ethiopia's economy has gone from strength to strength in recent years, and discovers the impact of war on Somalia, meeting a former NHS doctor who has returned to the country to help rebuild

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The presenter introduces the unique talents of the world's most intelligent animals, investigating how nature's masterminds measure up against human brain power. Looking at a variety of animals, such as ravens, crows, bees and starlings, Chris explores how different animals can use tools, solve complex puzzles, recognise themselves in mirrors and even reason like humans

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is at Elgin's port, the coastal town of Lossiemouth, where the Labour Party's first prime minister James Ramsay MacDonald was born. Nearby, Michael finds a remote boarding school established in the 1930s and famous today both for its unusual ideas and its royal former pupils. His penultimate stop is Inverness, where he uncovers the work of female photographer MEM Donaldson, who documented a Highland way of life that was rapidly disappearing. Michael's journey ends at Loch Ness, where he joins a Deep Scan research team scouring the deep for signs of the elusive monster

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of Charlestown in Cornwall, revealing how the villages's namesake Charles Rashleigh transformed the local trade and commerce from fishing and distribution of pilchards, to minerals exported by a hand-built port with pioneering technology. Ben looks at how Charles commissioned renowned engineer John Smeaton to create man-made lakes and hand-dug ponds, and explores their impact on the village's prosperity

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles continues his series charting the history of archaeological breakthroughs by looking at how discoveries in the 18th and 19th centuries overturned previously formed ideas of when and where civilisation began, as empires competed to make their beliefs prevalent

programme.title: Art of France
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon examines the development of Impressionism, when France was changing at a rapid pace and young artists re-invented the rules of painting - finding their muses in the bars, brothels and cabarets of Paris and turning the world of art on its head. Monet, Degas and their contemporaries launched a heated debate about the role of painting in the modern world that would pave the way for just about every modern art movement of note

programme.title: The Rise of the Murdoch Dynasty
programme.desc: Three-part documentary about the media mogul's influence on international politics and the power struggles within his own family. The first episode focuses on the build-up to the 1997 general election, where Rupert Murdoch had to decide if his business interests were best served by the continuation of John Major's struggling government, or a new Labour leadership under Tony Blair. Eventually, the full force of his media empire is placed behind the rising Labour leader, but some question how high a price was paid. Elsewhere, Murdoch marries a woman 37 years younger than he is, dividing his children and jeopardising his plans to choose a successor

programme.title: Donald Campbell: Speed King
programme.desc: A profile of the man who set eight world speed records on water and land in the 1950s and 1960s, using archive footage and first-hand testimonies from those who knew him. Campbell was spurred on by a desire to emulate his father Malcolm - who had also been a prolific record-breaker - but his career was dogged by ill fortune and bad weather. Jim Broadbent narrates

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles continues his series charting the history of archaeological breakthroughs by looking at how discoveries in the 18th and 19th centuries overturned previously formed ideas of when and where civilisation began, as empires competed to make their beliefs prevalent

Monet, Degas and their contemporaries launched a heated debate about the role of painting in the modern world that would pave the way for just about every modern art movement of note

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the West Country between the wars, setting off from the Cornish seaside resort of St Ives and ending his first in the former mining village of St Day

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales
programme.desc: Adventurer and explorer Paul Rose heads for Wensleydale as he sets out to explore the region, starting in the small town of Hawes, where locals now run many of their own services, including the buses. Paul checks out why cycling is so popular in the Dales and tries to get to the top of the Buttertubs Pass. Along the way he meets a family of dormice and spends time with a man who looks after one of the area's most imposing castles

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: In an attempt to spite Lionel, Jean decides to make a play for his publisher Alistair. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: Luke finds himself in the unusual position of spending a night at home alone. Why have both his wife and mistress deserted him at the same time? Carla Lane's love triangle comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Peter McEnery and Jane Asher. From 1987

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Historian Simon Schama continues his epic journey through time with a look at the 18th century. Renowned for being a period of economic growth that laid the foundations for the modern parliamentary state, it was also a time of uncertainty as the Jacobite claim to the throne threatened to undermine the progress of new forces in British society

programme.title: Bent Coppers: Crossing the Line of Duty
programme.desc: The final instalment reveals how, in the late 1970s, corruption within the City of London's CID had grown out of control - and how Operation Countryman was launched in response

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC film-maker Natalie Hewit spent three months in Antarctica following the work of the everyday heroes who have been challenged to move a vital polar research station, Halley VI. Built on the Brunt Ice Shelf, it sits far beyond the Antarctic shoreline, but a crevasse in the surrounding ice threatens to send the station adrift

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: The story of one of the world's biggest white-collar heists, which saw a Malaysian wealth fund looted of $3.5billion and involved government corruption at the highest level, abuse of power and international money laundering. With little to go on, investigative reporters from the New York Times, Wall Street Journal and Hollywood Reporter retrace the dirty money, via real-estate deals and movie financing including The Wolf of Wall Street, back to the top echelons of the Malaysian government. The Prime Minister and his inner circle are implicated, assets are frozen, money is seized and the Malaysian people fight back

programme.title: Africa with Ade Adepitan
programme.desc: Ade concludes his journey by exploring southern Africa. In Mozambique, he discovers that a declining tourist trade has benefited wildlife and explores local attitudes to disability. Moving on to South Africa, he investigates how much life has changed in the 25 years since the downfall of apartheid. His journey ends in Zimbabwe, a country that is still struggling economically despite having vast quantities of gold

programme.title: CBBC Live Lessons
programme.desc: Rhys Stephenson and Maddie Moate take over the Science Museum in London, with an out of this world forces Live Lesson for British Science Week! Our very own Live Lesson astronaut Frankie is stuck out in space after completing a mission to the moon, and needs the help of 7-11 year-olds everywhere to come back down to Earth. With help from a team of mission controllers, Rhys, Maddie and pupils watching need to use their knowledge of forces and explore gravity, friction and air resistance to design a landing module to bring our intrepid explorer safely back home. Along the way, we hear from real-life astronauts including Dr Helen Sharman, the first British astronaut in space and American astronaut Bob Hines who has recently returned from a NASA space mission.

programme.title: Out of This World
programme.desc: Dr Maggie uncovers the people and the missions that are tasked with looking for aliens in space and asks whether life really is out there and how will we find out. Dr Maggie’s star guest Sofia Sheikh is searching for intelligent life in the universe, while Maggie answers all your space questions. Her Top 5 is of the places where we might find extraterrestrial life. Buckle up, it’s time to go Out Of This World!

Peter Coxon is next to arrive, hoping the teamwork of Steve Fletcher and Dominic Chinea can provide a speedy recovery to a favourite childhood toy, a tin speed boat. programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Ireland (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the final match in the fourth and penultimate round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. After impressive victories over England and Wales, Scotland tasted defeat for the first time in the campaign last time out when they lost 32-21 to France in Paris. That result left Ireland as the one team still in with a chance of the Grand Slam, and they will be hopeful of emulating their 26-5 triumph over the Scots in Dublin last year. With analysis from Martin Johnson, John Barclay, and Tommy Bowe

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith discovers how cuts are affecting management of Dartmoor. She finds out how the major political parties are taking sides over to the right to camp debate, and catches up with author Guy Shrubsole to discover a rare rainforest in the UK. Matt Baker helps conservationists with a bird survey, Adam Henson visits an equine rehab centre, and Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn meets volunteers opening up Dartmoor for everyone. Plus, in the second of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles discovers what it takes to be a hill farmer in Wales

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores British woodland, grassland, freshwater and ocean habitats, revealing the surprising and dramatic wildlife that exist right on the doorstep, the existence of which is critical for the survival of species right across the globe. The first episode examines the benefits of Britain's natural geology and examines ways in which depleted islands can be restored for future generations

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Belmont House in Kent, where she encounters a disguised Michael McIntyre preparing a prank for his Saturday night show. Items brought in to be valued include an early David Hockney painting, a trophy awarded to Take That in 1995, a sword that once belonged to a member of the Dervish religious order, and a telegram announcing the end of the Second World War

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer sets up his timeshare business in Tenerife. When his passport expires, he is warned about his arrest and flees to Brazil. The police find details of a foreign bank account that has been laundering Brink's-Mat proceeds, and Boyce is sent to Switzerland on a mission to learn who controls it. McAvoy dreams up a prison escape plan, while Cooper and Parry are lured into a trap as the money is traced back to them

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from today's Premier League fixtures, including Fulham v Arsenal at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Southampton at St Mary's Stadium. The Gunners faced a test of their title credentials away to a Fulham side that have impressed this season, while United will have expected three points against the struggling Saints. Plus, Newcastle United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and West Ham United v Aston Villa

Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey goes to the police station, where she denies stealing the money in the face of Callum's questioning. Ravi plans to break into the Branning house to search for the information he needs only to be interrupted by Chelsea. Denise is desperate to set Keanu and Chelsea up on another date, Alfie is shocked by Freddie's money-making scheme and Emma undoes all Jay's good work with Lola and Lexi

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The teams make over different classrooms of a children's nursery in Oxfordshire - one for babies, one for toddlers and another for three to five-year-olds. Each room must feature different areas to accommodate various activities and safety is the key, and while dominates most of their plans, one team controversially opts for a shade of beige. What will Michele Ogundehin and guest judge Sophie Robinson think of the end results?

programme.title: Emma, Oti & Rylan's Big Red Nose Day Challenge
programme.desc: Emma Willis, Oti Mabuse and Rylan attempt to climb the Cairn Gorm mountain in the Scottish Highlands to raise money for Comic Relief. Starting from Braemar, the climbers receive a heroes' send off as they head away from the historic town and the toilet facilities. Their three-day expedition does not go as smoothly as they had hoped as 80mph winds threaten to end their journey before they barely get started

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team re-investigates the case of osteopath Danny Dyke. After the 30-year-old went missing in 1994, it was discovered that he was acting as a drug courier between London and Swansea. When his body was not found, he was presumed dead and a rumour quickly spread that he had been murdered. A remarkable chain of events led the police to a hillside near Swansea, where they located a fragment of bone that became key in the investigation

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim lands himself a role as an extra in a period biopic about a famous disabled musician. When some campaigners kick up a fuss about the star lead - James Norton - not being disabled, Tim is recast as the lead in a knee-jerk reaction to avoid media backlash. The bosses are so concerned with optics surrounding disability, they completely disregard the authenticity of the film - Tim doesn't even have the right disability and aside from that, cannot act to save his life. Chaos therefore ensues as he brings the production to its knees. Tim Renkow stars in this comedy a cerebral palsy sufferer who uses his condition to get away with saying what others are unable to

programme.title: Sully - Miracle on the Hudson (2016)
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood's fact-based drama, starring Tom Hanks as pilot Chesley 'Sully' Sullenberger, who rose to fame in January 2009 when he safely landed US Airways Flight 1549 in New York's Hudson River after the plane lost all engine power shortly after take-off - an event that captured the imagination of the world. Also starring Aaron Eckhart, Laura Linney and Anna Gunn

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates are tasked with creating and branding a new dog food before pitching to major retailers. In the kitchen one team argues over the recipe for their signature dish, while on the other side a premium product fails to deliver. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar assesses their collective efforts and removes another hopeful from the process

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Crystal Palace v Manchester City at Selhurst Park and Bournemouth v Liverpool at Vitality Stadium. Plus, Everton v Brentford, Leeds United v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leicester City v Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur v Nottingham Forest
