programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Matt's antique vibration device is sure to create a buzz in the Bidding Room. Will the bizarre Victorian medical device reach his desired price? Nigel Havers also meets Samantha and Joshua, who are hoping to sell their art deco cinema seat to fund a holiday

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Ireland (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the final match in the fourth and penultimate round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. After impressive victories over England and Wales, Scotland tasted defeat for the first time in the campaign last time out when they lost 32-21 to France in Paris. That result left Ireland as the one team still in with a chance of the Grand Slam, and they will be hopeful of emulating their 26-5 triumph over the Scots in Dublin last year. With analysis from Martin Johnson, John Barclay, and Tommy Bowe

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith discovers how cuts are affecting management of Dartmoor. She finds out how the major political parties are taking sides over to the right to camp debate, and catches up with author Guy Shrubsole to discover a rare rainforest in the UK. Matt Baker helps conservationists with a bird survey, Adam Henson visits an equine rehab centre, and Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn meets volunteers opening up Dartmoor for everyone. Plus, in the second of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles discovers what it takes to be a hill farmer in Wales

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores British woodland, grassland, freshwater and ocean habitats, revealing the surprising and dramatic wildlife that exist right on the doorstep, the existence of which is critical for the survival of species right across the globe. The first episode examines the benefits of Britain's natural geology and examines ways in which depleted islands can be restored for future generations

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Belmont House in Kent, where she encounters a disguised Michael McIntyre preparing a prank for his Saturday night show. Items brought in to be valued include an early David Hockney painting, a trophy awarded to Take That in 1995, a sword that once belonged to a member of the Dervish religious order, and a telegram announcing the end of the Second World War

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer sets up his timeshare business in Tenerife. When his passport expires, he is warned about his arrest and flees to Brazil. The police find details of a foreign bank account that has been laundering Brink's-Mat proceeds, and Boyce is sent to Switzerland on a mission to learn who controls it. McAvoy dreams up a prison escape plan, while Cooper and Parry are lured into a trap as the money is traced back to them

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from today's Premier League fixtures, including Fulham v Arsenal at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Southampton at St Mary's Stadium. The Gunners faced a test of their title credentials away to a Fulham side that have impressed this season, while United will have expected three points against the struggling Saints. Plus, Newcastle United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and West Ham United v Aston Villa

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Amy Irons presents action from the quarter-final between Rangers and Raith Rovers at Ibrox. Plus, the key moments from Hearts v Kilmarnock and Inverness Caledonian Thistle v Kilmarnock

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Chelsea v Manchester United, Arsenal v Reading and Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester City

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.desc: Rugby union player Danny Cipriani, W Series World Champion Jamie Chadwick, former Sunderland striker Kevin Phillips and Commonwealth gold medal-winning weightlifter Zoe Smith join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.desc: Alex Jones and Gethin Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Under pressure from Ravi, Denise considers breaking into Jack's laptop to get the information he needs. Jay and Lexi worry when Lola appears to zone out, but she refuses to get checked out. Freddie hits upon an idea to make cash for the struggling Slaters

programme.title: Disclosure: Out on the Pitch
programme.desc: Last year, Zander Murray became the first senior male footballer in Scotland to publicly come out as gay. Now, he embarks on a journey to explore what is being done to tackle homophobia in football, and looks at ways the sport can be made more inclusive

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the upper reaches of the River Dee, which rises higher than any river in the UK, from the Cairngorm mountains to Royal Deeside. In the heart of the Cairngorm mountains, he learns about writer and mountain lover Nan Shepherd's passion for the living landscape. Later on Royal Deeside, Paul is intrigued by the story of John Brown - Queen Victoria's very special friend who's photograph and ring she took to the grave

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Vernon gives the police a fake account of the incident, keeping Lou out of his story. He pretends to recognise her as Bill Slack's daughter, and angrily demands that she be removed, promptly suspending the interview. After he is taken into custody, Lou attempts to live a normal life within the law. But she still has to deal with suspicion from Sandy and finds herself pushed to breaking point

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: An Irish Goodbye (2022)
programme.desc: In rural Northern Ireland, two estranged brothers reunite following their mother's untimely death. Bafta-winning comedy drama, starring James Martin, Seamus O'Hara and Michelle Fairley

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public, and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. Over the last year, Panorama has had exclusive access to Kent Police as their detectives try to catch the fraudsters. The programme explores why so few cases are prosecuted and shows how fraudsters target the vulnerable, often using sophisticated techniques to dupe victims

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Builder Garry has been learning to drive for 30 years, and relies on wife Jeany to take him everywhere. Following an accident, Garry now has to pass to help her. Garry's battle is even tougher as his dyslexia makes following signs difficult, but Jeany is there with constant advice. During their five days at Scarlett's Driving School, there are near-misses on roundabouts and marital squabbles

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Vernon gives the police a fake account of the incident, keeping Lou out of his story. He pretends to recognise her as Bill Slack's daughter, and angrily demands that she be removed, promptly suspending the interview. After he is taken into custody, Lou attempts to live a normal life within the law. But she still has to deal with suspicion from Sandy and finds herself pushed to breaking point

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ireland's Rugby Number 10
programme.desc: A look at the story of the famous jersey and some of the finest players to have worn it. The documentary looks at the Irish fascination with the selection of the number 10, and the rivalries for the position such as those between Ollie Campbell and Tony Ward, and Ronan O'Gara and David Humphreys

programme.title: An Irish Goodbye (2022)
programme.desc: In rural Northern Ireland, two estranged brothers reunite following their mother's untimely death. Bafta-winning comedy drama, starring James Martin, Seamus O'Hara and Michelle Fairley

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: With the final in sight, the temperature is starting to rise. Who will stay loyal to their Warrior? And after a shock collapse, is this the end of the road for one trainee?

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The second of two compilations of highlights from the recent series. Among the guests featured are Tom Hanks, Cate Blanchett, Austin Butler, Michelle Yeoh, Hugh Jackman, Naomi Ackie, Brendan Fraser, Judi Dench, Jamie Dornan, Kate Winslet, Lizzo and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley appeal for information from the public about crimes around the country

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: An officer puts his life on the line when he tries to stop a dam from bursting and in south Wales a paramedic is assaulted on duty. Plus, armed robbers live stream a police chase

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Tommy Walsh meet the new owners of a house in Gillingham, a studio flat in London's East End and a damp-riddled semi in Stoke-on-Trent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Wrexham, North Wales, and discovers the gruesome history of St Winefride's Well. Experts Jonathan Pratt and Tim Weeks assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Luca meets Jamie's mum and Nina has an idea to help The Mill. Suni helps a student struggling to leave their old life behind

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay and his guests demonstrate how to grow potatoes, replace broken guttering, build a shoe bench and create a loft hatch

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple who are returning to the UK from Malaysia after becoming grandparents, and are keen to find a home in the Herefordshire countryside

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha and Phil continue on their antiquing adventure. While Natasha uncovers an early silver sandwich box and a Scottish spirit kettle, Phil finds a Victorian fish service

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: An intrepid team of four work colleagues competes for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, presented by Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey goes to the police station, where she denies stealing the money in the face of Callum's questioning. Ravi plans to break into the Branning house to search for the information he needs only to be interrupted by Chelsea. Denise is desperate to set Keanu and Chelsea up on another date, Alfie is shocked by Freddie's money-making scheme and Emma undoes all Jay's good work with Lola and Lexi

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The teams make over different classrooms of a children's nursery in Oxfordshire - one for babies, one for toddlers and another for three to five-year-olds. Each room must feature different areas to accommodate various activities and safety is the key, and while dominates most of their plans, one team controversially opts for a shade of beige. What will Michele Ogundehin and guest judge Sophie Robinson think of the end results?

programme.title: Emma, Oti & Rylan's Big Red Nose Day Challenge
programme.desc: Emma Willis, Oti Mabuse and Rylan attempt to climb the Cairn Gorm mountain in the Scottish Highlands to raise money for Comic Relief. Starting from Braemar, the climbers receive a heroes' send off as they head away from the historic town and the toilet facilities. Their three-day expedition does not go as smoothly as they had hoped as 80mph winds threaten to end their journey before they barely get started

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Stephen Dempster investigates the use of plastic bullets on the streets and claims that the government knew of their potential to kill. Spotlight speaks to the soldiers who fired them, the families who lost loved ones and those still searching for answers

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: The trainees are just one step from the final, but one of them has been keeping a secret that will change everything

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates are tasked with creating and branding a new dog food before pitching to major retailers. In the kitchen one team argues over the recipe for their signature dish, while on the other side a premium product fails to deliver. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar assesses their collective efforts and removes another hopeful from the process

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. programme.title: Talking Movies
programme.desc: Talking Movies reports from Los Angeles ahead of Hollywood's biggest night of the year - the Oscars. With the sci-fi action comedy Everything Everywhere All at Once leading the Oscars race, the preview programme hears from its Asian star Michelle Yeoh and looks at how this has been a record year for Asian actors in terms of nominations. With Steven Spielberg's semi-autobiographical The Fabelmans up for seven Oscars, Talking Movies also features an interview with the acclaimed Hollywood director on why the film is so important to him. Other big names whose movies are in the running include Cate Blanchett, Brendan Fraser and director James Cameron - they each discuss their Oscar-nominated work with presenter Tom Brook. Also, India's prolific film industry is often overlooked by the Academy, but this year the country has picked up a best original song nomination for its epic action international blockbuster RRR as well as getting recognition in the documentary feature and documentary shor

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. Over the past year, Panorama has had access to Kent Police as their detectives try to catch the fraudsters. With more than 10,000 reports of fraud in the county last year, they estimate that only around 20 cases were solved. The report explores why so few cases are prosecuted and shows how fraudsters target the vulnerable, often using sophisticated techniques to dupe victims into handing over their cash

programme.title: Ronia, Nighean a' Mheirlich/Ronja, the Robber's Daughter
programme.desc: Autumn is here and Ronia and Biorc are worried about winter, which is not far away. Mata appears, offering a home for them

programme.title: An Sgoil
programme.desc: A school inspector pays a surprise visit to Sgoil Taobh na Cloiche. It’s not looking good for Mr MacFhraing, although Mr Strachan seems to have found his feet. What could possibly go wrong?

programme.title: Saidheans Sporsail (Backyard Science)
programme.desc: Fun science experiments, including how to eavesdrop on friends using a super spy listening device and bend a ball like David Beckham

programme.title: Mach à Seo!

He passes by the house that JRR Tolkien once stayed in, visits a beach where the sand makes strange squeaking noises underfoot and hikes up Eigg’s iconic an Sgùrr, a striking volcanic ridge, for views across the archipelago and to Skye

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go

programme.title: Mr Magoo

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. In order to be as popular as Santa Claus, Fizz leaves presents on everyone's doorsteps. But Magoo has launched Operation Clean Streets and throws away Fizz's presents, thinking he's cleaning up.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. To become more popular, Fizz creates a useful robot designed to service the residents of the city. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Sybil's determination to pursue her political leanings lands her in great danger when a fight breaks out at an election results meeting. Matthew's tenderness in caring for the would-be suffragette is noticed by her sisters, but it is Mary who is stunned to receive a marriage proposal. Bates is cleared of suspicion over the stolen wine, but offers his resignation rather than name the culprit. Drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Cora makes a discovery that throws the inheritance issue into chaos, and Mary is prompted to keep Matthew waiting for an answer to his proposal. Robert arranges for Mrs Patmore to see an eye specialist, and O'Brien digs up more compromising information about Bates, but the Earl's response comes as a surprise. Thomas leaves the Abbey and Mary exacts vengeance on Edith for her treachery, while the household is rocked by a shocking announcement. Drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: It is November 1916, and the family and servants are getting the house ready for a concert to raise funds to treat more casualties from the front. Bates returns from London with a proposal for Anna, while Isobel informs Robert and Cora that Matthew is engaged and wants to bring his fiancee to Downton. O'Brien plays a trick on new maid Ethel after taking an instant dislike to her. Costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Isobel suggests using Downton as a place of convalescence following a distressing incident at the village hospital. Shell-shocked new valet Lang arrives as William gets his call-up papers, and Carson strives to keep standards high, but suffers a panic attack in front of the family. Lady Rosamund is eager to unearth Lavinia and Carlisle's secret after overhearing them arguing, and romance blossoms for both Edith and Mary. Costume drama, starring Jim Carter, Samantha Bond and Cal Macaninch

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The wounded officers arrive at Downton and Matthew suggests he bring General Sir Herbert Strutt to inspect the new convalescent home - but Branson decides to spoil the visit after failing his army medical. Meanwhile, William's return results in an awkward surprise for Daisy, and Violet and Rosamund discover Lavinia's past misdeeds. Costume drama, starring Dan Stevens, Allen Leech, Thomas Howes, Maggie Smith and Zoe Boyle

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to create a garden as a wedding present, and find a baby under a gooseberry bush. The discovery brings out Rosemary's maternal side as the pair investigate who abandoned the child. Their task is complicated by the murder of an artistic neighbour - and the two mysterious incidents appear to be connected. Starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo visit a resort in Spain to create a trophy garden for a pro-am tennis tournament run by a former champion. While investigating, Laura enters the mysterious world of bullfighting, and Rosemary rediscovers her love of motor scooters

Ali then blindfolds Bob and drives him to a top-secret lake at a classified location - here they hope to catch some of the mysterious big carp that reside there. Two Michelin-starred chef Daniel is also smuggled into the venue, and he sets the lads a cooking competition to hopefully fuel them for further catches

programme.title: In the Line of Fire (1993)
programme.desc: An ageing secret service agent, tormented by his failure to save the life of John F Kennedy in 1963, is drawn into a battle of wits with a sinister CIA-trained assassin out to kill the current president. As the day of reckoning draws closer, the agent's nerves are tested to the limit - and nothing seems to be going his way. Wolfgang Petersen's thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, John Malkovich, Rene Russo and Dylan McDermott

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd always has Abacus over for dinner, so PB persuades Malcolm and Gena to let her invite Julie the Spider for dinner too. programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A heavy metal extraction platform carrying toxic waste at the bottom of the ocean experiences a devastating fire. Gordon rushes in with Thunderbird 4 when the rolling factory damages its steering capabilities. With the help of Lady Penelope and Parker on the surface investigating the dealings of dubious executive Hector Ambrose, boss of the company Hydrexla, Gordon sets about rescuing platform operator Ned Tedford and his plant Gladys and prevent the rig from losing its toxic cargo

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George finds a computer called Val but Val has a mind of her own. Soon she's set about uploading embarrassing videos to social media.

programme.title: Mr Magoo

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. In order to be as popular as Santa Claus, Fizz leaves presents on everyone's doorsteps. But Magoo has launched Operation Clean Streets and throws away Fizz's presents, thinking he's cleaning up.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. To become more popular, Fizz creates a useful robot designed to service the residents of the city. But when his android picks up Marnie's misplaced handkerchief, Magoo gets jealous and believes he has a rival for her affections.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. A bird on the loose indoors sends everyone into hiding - Lloyd, who has been separated from Abacus and trapped in a pen lid with his neighbour Molly, is struggling with the notion of doing nothing and waiting it out, so he starts trying to think up an escape plan.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd and Abacus are on the hunt for a nice quiet spot to play their favourite board game - the trouble is that everywhere is either too loud, too busy, or too dangerous! They finally find the perfect place... but then they forget to take gravity into account.

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: Comedy arts and crafts show presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bursting with unique makes, top tips and inspirational art ideas, Bec experiments with recycled materials and uses her funny bones to make us laugh along the way. Bec is tired on her shift at the Takeaway, so tries out different ideas to stay awake. Plus, she surprises a Bollywood dance teacher with some colourful Rangoli art.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: It's only three days until the next Speedway Five-Billion race, the most dangerous race in the world! Its racers want to risk everything for this because the stakes have never been higher as the winner takes home the ultimate reward - the coveted Key-tana! Meet legendary racers like Ratso, Racer Seven, and a mysterious unknown racer who looks oddly familiar...

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?

programme.desc: A new apprentice to an eccentric vet in the Yorkshire Dales quickly discovers life in the country is not as idyllic as he thought. Drama based on the series of books by James Herriot, starring Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Lisa Harrow, Freddie Jones and TP McKenna

programme.title: My Fair Lady (1964)
programme.desc: Henry Higgins, a professor of phonetics, bets his friend Colonel Pickering that he can teach cockney flower girl Eliza Doolittle to speak like a duchess. Oscar-winning musical, based on George Bernard Shaw's play Pygmalion, starring Audrey Hepburn, Rex Harrison and Stanley Holloway. Songs include I Could Have Danced All Night, and Wouldn't It Be Loverly

programme.title: When Holidays Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: A selection of disastrous excursions, featuring a visit to the zoo that ended in horror when a young family encountered an escaped chimpanzee. Plus, a day at a safari park turns to a walk on the wild side as two duelling camels cause £6,000 of damage to a car, rendering it a write-off, while a tourist soon regretted going on a hang-gliding day trip in the Swiss Alps when his pilot failed to attach the safety cord

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: The Radfords address the question of why they have such a big family, confronting whether the answer lies in the fact that they were both adopted at birth. Noel decides it's the right time to discover more about his birth parents, leading to emotional discoveries with potentially life-changing consequences

programme.title: Britpop: The Music That Changed Britain
programme.desc: Documentary charting the birth, the rise and the fall of the music culture movement that put the focus on Britishness, looking at the intertwining fortunes and rivalries of Blur, Oasis, Suede and Elastica. Suede insiders about how its started with the band's glam-inspired sound and first album, while Alex James and Dave Rowntree of Blur reveal how their band's disastrous first tour of America triggered a reboot and reappraisal that saw them embrace Britishness, culminating in the classic Parklife album

programme.title: Oasis: Live
programme.desc: A 2001 concert by the band at Glasgow's Barrowland Ballroom, featuring performances of songs including Go Let It Out, Supersonic, Live Forever, Roll with It, Don't Look Back in Anger, Cigarettes & Alcohol and Supersonic

Plus, a Dutch dog that thinks it's a car, a very clumsy French undertaker, and a burger that sings Elvis songs in South Africa

programme.title: The Gypsies Next Door
programme.desc: Documentary following travellers' constant struggle to co-exist with settled communities. Carol and her family cannot understand why her community is so hated and vilified, while local man Arthur is on a mission to understand what brings the travellers into parks and public areas - and Carol's caravan is his first stop. Johnny and his family live in a chalet in Essex but his non-traveller wife Andrea has had enough of feeling ostracised and wants to move back into a normal house

programme.title: The Gypsies Next Door
programme.desc: In the Irish town of Thurles, the council want Barry to move into new housing purpose-built for travellers. But they will not allow him to take his 30 horses. Teenager Scarlett, who lives with her traveller family in Luton, dreams of being a successful model - and non-traveller model Danielle Mason is going to help show her the way

programme.title: The Railways That Built Britain with Chris Tarrant
programme.desc: The broadcaster examines the role of the railways during the two global conflicts of the 20th century, keeping vital supply lines open and transporting troops to and from the front. In the First World War, railway works were converted into munitions factories and women were employed for these dangerous jobs and their heroic efforts helped win them the vote, while in the Second World War, they were vital in organising the evacuation of a million children and offered underground shelters from air raids

Monday morning rush hour sees ticket inspector Pranab braving a tide of morning commuters pouring out from the platforms as he seeks out fare dodgers, while a signal failure halts the progress of the most prestigious service on the entire Indian network in the form of the Rajdhani Express, the luxury overnight train from Calcutta to Delhi

Meanwhile, African elephant calf Nusu is growing up fast, but cannot quite master all of his various appendages, and when he tries to run on muddy ground, he ends up in a heap. programme.desc: Graeme Hall meets an excitable English Bulldog that welcomes new guests by latching onto them with his vice-like grip, and owners Sarah and Andrew disagree on how best to tame him. programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben spends a week in Dorset with former paratrooper Chris who, despite losing nearly everything, has spent the last five years walking the UK's coastline. Ben joins Chris and his faithful dog companion, Jet, 27,000 miles into their walk, and also meets Chris' partner and fellow hiker, Kate. Whilst in their company, Ben learns how to desalinate sea water, forage the nature around him and how to charm local fisherman for food

programme.title: Who Killed Billie-Jo?
programme.desc: Examining the unsolved case of 13-year-old Billie-Jo Jenkins, who was murdered on the patio of her seaside home in 1997. This documentary reveals how and why Sion Jenkins, Billie-Jo's foster father, was initially convicted of the murder, only to be acquitted following a high-profile appeal and two major retrials at the Old Bailey

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Psychologists and criminology experts analyse the crimes of cinema entrepreneur Peter Moore, who brutally murdered four men in Wales in 1995

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: In June 1985, TWA flight 847 made a routine stop-off in Athens, Greece. Its destination was Rome, but that changed after armed Lebanese militia boarded the plane. Against the backdrop of the Middle East conflict, the terrorists had one objective in mind - the release of hundreds of Islamic prisoners detained in Israel. Seizing the US airliner shortly after take-off, the passengers and crew - including singer Demis Roussos - endured a three-day ordeal involving a stream of landings across various airports. This documentary recalls their experiences

programme.title: The Blitz: Britain on Fire
programme.desc: Michael Buerk, Angellica Bell and Rob Bell tell the story of eight days in May 1941, when Britain, and Liverpool in particular, was subjected to intense bombardment. They focus on Margaret Johnson, a mother of six who had been bombed out of one home, and Mary Lawson, a promising film star in 1940s Britain. Plus, a look at Churchill's morale-boosting tour of bombed Britain

programme.title: World's Busiest Train Stations
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at Flinders Street station in Melbourne, which is not just the busiest and oldest in Australia, but in the whole of the southern hemisphere. The start of the Australian Open tennis tournament means that many more passengers than usual are expected, while the control room braces itself for even more trouble after trespassers are spotted walking on a busy line

programme.title: Nick's Quest
programme.desc: Naturalist Nick Baker swims with rare giant river otters in the tropical waters of Karanambo, Guyana, and finds out what conservationists are doing to protect them

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The children visit the zoo, where they are shown around by zookeepers Mr Lion, Mrs Crocodile and Mr Giraffe

programme.title: It Came from Beneath the Sea (1954)
programme.desc: The captain of a nuclear submarine battles a gigantic octopus threatening to destroy San Francisco. Monster adventure, starring Kenneth Tobey, Faith Domergue and Donald Curtis, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa (2008)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals discover a plane and, following a swift repair job by the penguins, manage to escape the desolate shores of Madagascar. However, they crash-land on the plains of Africa and find themselves face-to-face with their wild counterparts for the first time. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Little Women (2019)
programme.desc: In 1868, New York City teacher Jo March goes to Mr Dashwood, an editor who agrees to publish a story she has written. She reflects back and forth on her life, telling the story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms. Writer/director Greta Gerwig's adaptation of the Louisa May Alcott novel, starring Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson and Florence Pugh

programme.title: Bend It Like Beckham (2002)
programme.desc: An English schoolgirl tries to hide her passion for football from her strict Indian parents, knowing they disapprove of her tomboyish love of the game. However, when a semi-professional player sees her in action, she is offered a place on a team, forcing her to come up with a complex plan to keep her sporting career under wraps. Comedy, with Parminder Nagra, Keira Knightley, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Juliet Stevenson and Shaznay Lewis

programme.title: Terminator: Dark Fate (2019)
programme.desc: An augmented human and Sarah Connor must stop an advanced liquid Terminator named Rev-9 from hunting down a young girl in Mexico City, whose fate is critical to the human race. As the Rev-9 ruthlessly destroys everything and everyone in its path, the three are led to a T-800 from Sarah's past that may be their last best hope. Sci-fi adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton and Mackenzie Davis

programme.title: Vivarium (2019)
programme.desc: Young couple Gemma and Tom are keen to buy their first home together, but when they do, things take a strange turn. Sci-fi thriller starring Jesse Eisenberg and Imogen Poots

programme.title: Carol (2015)
programme.desc: A housewife trapped in a loveless marriage in 1950s New York forms a close attachment with a younger woman seeking fulfilment in her own life. A passionate secret affair develops, but as her husband grows suspicious, she finds her competence as a parent being called into question. Romantic drama based on Patricia Highsmith's novel The Price of Salt, starring Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara

programme.title: You, Me, Garden?
programme.desc: Clara and the gardening team head to south London on a mission to create a mini urban farm in Mari + Ali's disused courtyard

programme.title: The Duel at Silver Creek (1952)
programme.desc: A gambler goes after the gang of claim jumpers who killed his father, and joins forces with an injured marshal who also wants the criminals brought to justice. However, their partnership is tested when a devious femme fatale enters their lives. Don Siegel's Western, starring Audie Murphy, Stephen McNally and Faith Domergue

programme.title: To Hell and Back (1955)
programme.desc: Biopic of actor Audie Murphy, following his service in the Second World War. Enlisting in the Army as a teenager to support his younger siblings, he excelled himself in action in the conflict in Europe and became one of America's most decorated soldiers. Starring Murphy as himself alongside Marshall Thompson, Charles Drake and Gregg Palmer

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass (1967)
programme.desc: A cavalry captain sets out to deliver a shipment of rifles to a fort besieged by marauding Apaches, but the mission is undermined by a villainous corporal who plans to steal the weapons and sell them to the enemy. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Michael Burns, Laraine Stephens, Kenneth Tobey and Michael Keep

programme.title: Winchester '73 (1950)
programme.desc: A gunslinger tracks down his father's killer, but is unable to exact his revenge because the sheriff of the town makes a point of confiscating all firearms. Instead he challenges him to compete in a shooting competition to win a superb rifle, but when the murderer loses, he steals the coveted prize. Western, starring James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea and Stephen McNally

programme.title: Charlotte Gray (2001)
programme.desc: An unassuming woman agrees to spy for the British during the Second World War and infiltrates occupied France, while embarking on a quest to locate her pilot lover, who has been shot down. Drama adapted from Sebastian Faulks' novel, starring Cate Blanchett, Billy Crudup, Rupert Penry-Jones and Michael Gambon

programme.title: Bandits (2001)
programme.desc: Two convicts escape from prison and embark on a high-profile bank-robbing spree. A car crash leaves them with an extra accomplice - a bored housewife yearning for adventure, but before long her presence begins to disrupt their criminal enterprise and friendship, as well as their plans to retire to Mexico. Crime comedy, starring Bruce Willis, Billy Bob Thornton and Cate Blanchett. Directed by Barry Levinson

programme.title: Elizabeth (1998)
programme.desc: Elizabeth I rises to the throne of a divided and troubled Britain, and the early years of her reign find her under pressure to marry and produce an heir - while enemies both overseas and within her own court plot to bring about her downfall. Shekhar Kapur's historical drama, starring Cate Blanchett, Geoffrey Rush, Christopher Eccleston and Joseph Fiennes

programme.title: Thunder Road (2018)
programme.desc: A US police officer finds his life falling apart after the death of his mother. During a messy divorce, he attempts to find solace in building a stronger relationship with his young daughter, but events are already spiralling beyond his control. Comedy drama, starring Jim Cummings, Nican Robinson, Jocelyn DeBoer and Kendal Farr

programme.title: At Gunpoint (1955)
programme.desc: A peaceable shopkeeper becomes a local hero when he accidentally kills the leader of a gang of bank robbers. However, when the dead bandit's partners in crime come looking for retribution, he finds the friends and neighbours who praised his bravery are now about to abandon him. Western, starring Fred MacMurray, Dorothy Malone and Walter Brennan

programme.title: Santa Fe Passage (1955)
programme.desc: A wagon scout accused of collusion with Apaches is given a chance to redeem himself when he is hired to transport a shipment of arms to Santa Fe. The owner of the valuable freight happens to be a mixed-race woman and at first he shows her only disrespect, but has to overcome his prejudice when he finds himself falling for her. Western adventure, with John Payne, Faith Domergue and Slim Pickens

programme.title: Apache Uprising (1965)
programme.desc: Western, starring Rory Calhoun as a tough-talking cowboy with a heart of gold who bravely defends fellow stagecoach passengers from a potentially lethal Indian attack. Also starring Corinne Calvet, Lon Chaney Jr and John Russell

programme.title: Picnic (1955)
programme.desc: A drifter turns up in a small American town looking for a well-off old friend in the hope of borrowing money. However, he causes nothing but trouble for the locals, seducing both his old pal's fiancee and a local schoolteacher. Drama based on William Inge's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, starring William Holden, Cliff Robertson and Kim Novak

programme.title: GI Joe: The Rise of Cobra (2009)
programme.desc: When a powerful experimental weapon is snatched by a mysterious terrorist organisation, two of the soldiers guarding it are recruited into a top-secret military strike force. As they go in search of the stolen technology, they uncover a plot by its creator to take over the world. Action adventure, with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: The Equalizer (2014)
programme.desc: A retired secret agent applies his talents to the task of helping victims of injustice. When he witnesses a prostitute being beaten up by a pimp, he kills the man, an act that draws him into a battle to the death with a Russian crime syndicate. Action thriller based on the 1980s TV series, starring Denzel Washington and Chloe Grace Moretz

programme.title: Call Me by Your Name (2017)
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Elio spends his lazy summers at his family's Italian villa, where his academic father welcomes research assistant Oliver to help with his work on Greco-Roman culture. Before long Elio and Oliver grow close, leading to a summer that will alter both of their lives for ever. Director Luca Guadagnino's Oscar and Bafta-winning romantic drama, based on the novel by André Aciman, starring Armie Hammer, Timothee Chalamet and Michael Stuhlbarg

programme.title: Menashe (2017)
programme.desc: Deep in the heart of New York's notoriously secretive Hasidic Jewish community, grocery store clerk Menashe struggles against tradition to keep custody of his only son after his wife passes away. Drama, starring Menashe Lustig. In Yiddish

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: A plea hearing prompts true feelings to rise to the surface, while things go from bad to worse for Romeo when he wrongly accuses his crush of sleeping with his best friend

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Tahnee and Ollie meet for the first time at the altar, and despite being the youngest couple in this year's experiment, both are old souls with traditional views of relationships

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: When Caitlin and Shannon meet at the altar for the first time the connection is immediate, while Alyssa and Duncan are instantly smitten by each other

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of Finn McCool's, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, New York. The chances of the establishment becoming a success are being ruined by the owner Buddy Mazzio's two sons, bartender Jason and chef Brian, who are constantly fighting with each other, prompting Gordon to have a heart-to-heart with the family

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the guys are unable to get tickets for Comic-Con, Leonard, Howard and Raj decide to buy fake passes from a stranger - but they then worry about getting caught with them. Sheldon decides to hold his own comic-book convention and searches for a suitable star guest for the event. Meanwhile, the girls take tea at a hotel but discover that maturity is over-rated. Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Melissa Rauch

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, the third instalment in the successful franchise. Harrison Ford stars as the titular hero, alongside Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott

programme.desc: Awkward teenagers Will, Simon and Neil find university life does not live up to their expectations, and are insanely jealous of Jay's stories of his gap year in Australia. Comedy sequel, starring Simon Bird, James Buckley, Joe Thomas and Blake Harrison

programme.title: The Inbetweeners

Meanwhile, Simon faces problems when his parents separate. Simon Bird and Joe Thomas star

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will becomes stressed as the friends prepare for their exams - apart from Jay, who finds himself preoccupied. Simon makes progress with Carli by helping her revise, and they all reminisce about the events of the past year. Comedy, starring Simon Bird

programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Starkville, Mississippi, to try to rescue the failing Hotel Chester. Despite having more than 40 years' experience in the business, owner David Mollendor is at a loss as to how to make his dream of owning his own hotel work, while his wife Sukie is struggling as its chef, tackling the role without any formal catering experience. Gordon discovers a family tragedy that explains why this couple have become trapped in their business and wrestling with debt

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a dog-friendly hotel in West Dover, Vermont, that is in urgent need of help. Owner Sandy MacDougall runs the Four Seasons Inn like a hostel, with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests. The acerbic chef aims to get the business back on track before Sandy loses everything, but wonders whether it would be kinder to simply put this dog-friendly hotel to sleep

US cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher

George returns to find out whether they have managed to finish the property to the same exceptional standards

programme.desc: Rick visits Tintagel, Cornwall's most mythical place, which was an important trading port with Europe and the birthplace of perhaps Britain's greatest legend - the tale of King Arthur. He also learns how the Methodists were important to Cornwall, and how they would cook a rather unusual bun during feast days, and meets a family on the Roseland Peninsula who are continuing the surprisingly ancient tradition of growing an exotic spice - saffron

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the rich and diverse history of West Penwith, the farthest point west in mainland Britain. He visits Lamorna Cove, made famous through song and art, and the Unesco-protected tin and copper mining area of Botallack, where he talks to a mining explorer. The chef also follows an ancient track in search of Cornwall's oldest building and reveals how, as a young lad on the Lizard Peninsula, he fell in love for the first time and tasted his first French fish stew - known as a bouillabaisse

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: As the chef's Cornish odyssey nears its end, he takes a break in the city of Truro, where he discovers an unusual ghost story and tours the magnificent cathedral. He also meets a family passionate about offal, who prepare Rick a meal of pickled ox tongue and beef heart tacos, and in the county's most northerly parish he tells the story of an eccentric vicar who would retrieve the bodies from nearby shipwrecks and bury them in his church graveyard

programme.desc: Tim Glover finds a super rare two-door Toyota Carina as the Lazy Boys try to move into the Japanese retro car scene, but this time they may have bitten off more than they can chew

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The work of a team of mechanics who build bespoke cars for the Merseyside Police. Emergency surgery is needed when a brand-new prisoner van gets on the wrong side of a rooftop protestor. Boss Mick spends some time behind bars - all in the name of research, while the mounted unit needs help to get to the Liverpool-Everton derby

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. A Victoria operation targets the large-scale cannabis cultivation activities of a number of Vietnamese immigrants in the suburbs of Melbourne.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police search for two men wanted in relation to a robbery and move in on a suspected drug dealer's house in the hope of finding evidence.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a culinary journey by sea and land to explore the Far East's most diverse food cultures. He begins in Cambodia, where tourists are beginning to return after the fall of the Khmer Rouge regime. As well as discovering the joys of freshly caught swimmer crabs with green peppercorns, he learns how to cook the country's most famous dish - fish amok - and samples lok lak, made with marinated beef. He also visits the Angkor Wat temple and joins a rice barge to travel down the Mekong River

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling down the Mekong River to Vietnam, where the local diet features an abundance of herbs, freshwater fish and flavoursome soups. As well as following in the footsteps of his hero Graham Greene in Saigon, he is reunited with a former employee in Hanoi to try out the capital city's street food, and samples the produce on offer at the night-time stalls in Bangkok, Thailand

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police hunt for a man suspected of stealing rural machinery, rush to a derelict factory to seize firearms, and investigate a car accident.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police execute a search warrant on a counterfeiting market stall and intervene to get an excessively low-riding car off the road for good.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The workshop struggles to convert three quad bikes into frontline police vehicles, while an officer has to crash a pursuit car to protect the public. Steve wants to share his home-made birthday cake - if only he can persuade someone to eat it

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tries out the Lotus T125, which brings F1-style performance to the track, and an updated version of the classic Jensen Interceptor. Bob Geldof gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car, and the trio employ all manner of second-hand military equipment to knock down a row of derelict houses, aiming to complete the job in less time than a team of demolition experts

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May set out for the seaside in electric cars the Nissan Leaf and Peugeot iOn, stopping off in Lincoln along the way. Louis Walsh gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car, Richard Hammond meets an extraordinary rally team in which everyone, from mechanics to drivers, is an amputee with a military background, and the Lamborghini Aventador is taken out on the track

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: From everyday heroes to Oz's top sportsmen and women, Australian athletes are all lining up to take their shot at the most difficult obstacle course in the world

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Comedian Katherine Ryan joins host Richard Ayoade on a 48-hour ram raid of the Big Apple. The duo's packed-to-overflow schedule sees them scale tall buildings, grab some culture in museums large and small and even attempt to rollerblade. Experiences include trips to the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Rockefeller Centre, queuing at the hottest patisserie in Manhattan for a cronut, and enjoying a free ferry ride to the Statue of Liberty. There's even time for Richard to reach the point of meltdown

programme.title: Taskmaster

A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the weekly scores are tallied resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday, when the victor chooses between a House of Games dartboard and a branded dressing gown

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian and writer Roisin Conaty, footballer-turned-pundit Chris Kamara and comedian and actor Nish Kumar to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include bread at restaurants, downloading music and ex-partners

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: Taskmaster

programme.desc: Mick Sweetmore's team tries to fix a radio issue in a bid to keep the new pursuit cars on the tail of Merseyside's criminals. There's a surprise visit from the fleet's oldest member, and the bosses get dirty hands when things go wrong on the road

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Police in Western Australia conduct a two-day drug-dealing operation that exposes one suspect's ownership of a large number of dogs in poor condition.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. programme.desc: The second heat of Oz's take on the hit format features the Battle of the Tradies, the only husband-and-wife team, Queenslander larrikin mates and a former elite gymnast

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Time-conscious traveller Richard Ayoade is joined by actor Paul Rudd for a brisk romp round the Finnish capital. To get their bearings the pair head straight to the ladies toilet in the Torni hotel, which offers the best view of the city. They then go kayaking and snack on some reindeer jerky at the city's Hakaniemi market. Richard and Paul also visit not one, but two saunas - one of which can be found in a well-known burger chain. The duo also visit the wilderness island of Seurasaari, go foraging, and finish up in a sweet shop

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: Impossible Engineering

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: The bravery of the 333rd Field Artillery Battalion, a depleted unit of African-American soldiers who risked everything to fight off the Nazis at Bastogne, Belgium

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: The story of the siege of Kohima in 1944, when heavily outnumbered British and Indian troops held off Japanese forces until reinforcements could arrive

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo resumes his tour of the Home Counties in the historic town of Guildford. Later, in Chilworth, he follows his 1936 Bradshaw's guide to Newlands Corner on the slopes of the North Downs. Eventually he crosses into Hampshire to reach Aldershot

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads for Farnborough, Hampshire, famous today for its airshow and home to what was then the Royal Aircraft Establishment. In Basingstoke he visits a glorious neo-Gothic stately home set in the North Wessex Downs

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores East Anglia between the wars, beginning at Sutton Hoo in Suffolk, where archaeologists discovered a 27-metre-long Anglo-Saxon ship in 1939. In the Essex village of Dedham, he unearths a nasty brush between painters, with art experts explaining the antipathy between traditional artist Alfred Munnings and the modern art school established in the village by Cedric Morris

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through East Anglia, where he discovers the Essex origins of the BBC and joins the Women's Land Army to pick damsons at Tiptree

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's Bradshaw travels resume in leafy Hertfordshire, where he attempts a canoe slalom course at the Lee Valley White Water Centre, built for the London Olympics in 2012. Travelling north, the presenter reaches Hatfield and the country estate of the queen of romance and author of 723 books, Barbara Cartland. In Stevenage, Michael learns how, in 1935, a new enterprise boosted production of the nation's daily loaf with a factory in the town.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads for the Hertfordshire village of Perry Green to learn about Henry Moore became one of the defining artists of British modernism. In Cambridge, he revisits his former university to hear about a treacherous time in its past

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Suffolk on the last leg of his 1930s Bradshaw's inspired tour of East Anglia, visiting the racecourse at Newmarket and the Roman Catholic shrine at Walsingham

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Crewe, a town steeped in railway history, to investigate the making of cinema classic The Night Mail during the 1930s. Torn between buying a place in Dorset within easy reach of her London home for a budget of £250,000, and the Costa Tropical in Spain, where she would have a budget of £150,000, she requires help. Jasmine Harman shows her three options in Dorset, and Laura Hamilton tries to impress her with three properties in Spain, but, with the help of her sister Sara, which one will Ginny choose?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jackie and Kevin Harper have been holidaying in Barbados for over 30 years with their four children, and have now decided that the time is right to buy their own holiday home on the island they love. programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Juliette and Jonathan Cottam are selling their London home to retire elsewhere, but are torn between two very different locations. Juliette dreams of a life in France, where she spent much of her childhood. With a budget of £250,000, she thinks the Dordogne region would be the perfect location. Jonathan wants to stay in the UK with a budget of up to £350,000 and move to Devon where he grew up. Jasmine Harman tempts Juliette with three properties in Devon, while Lara Hamilton shows them three fantastic French homes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jason and Lindsay Crossland from East Yorkshire met 28 years ago when they were working for the RAF. They have a budget of up to £180,000, but will Ben Hillman be able to find them what they're looking for?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Shop manager Nicola Steele hosts the first dinner party in Cardiff, and hopes that her dog-themed surprises and unusual entertainment will impress her guests - army wife Rachael Smith, casting agency owner Jerry Lockett, childminder Andrea Grainger and chatterbox Sam Clark - and win her the £1,000 cash prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Costume designer Sam Clarke prepares a Mexican menu for the fourth dinner party in Cardiff. Everything does not go to plan, however, when two guests begin fighting at the table, and his 'fun' game leaves everyone in tears

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Childminder Andrea Grainger hosts the last dinner party as the competition in Cardiff draws to a close. As the evening comes to an end, the diners discover which of the meals made the best impression

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Joe and Di Lunn relocated to Australia in 1967 to bring up their five children. Now that their youngest daughter has moved back to Yorkshire, they're looking for a holiday home that's within easy reach of her where they can spend up to five months of the year. However, they can't decide on where it should be. Joe wants to return to his Yorkshire roots while Di wants to buy in Normandy France. With a budget of £140,000 Jasmine Harman shows them three fantastic properties in West Yorkshire, while Jonnie Irwin tries to tempt them with three French homes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Michelle and Charlotte from Stevenage are looking for Michelle's dream holiday home on Lanzarote. As a family of four, they have been coming to the island for more than 10 years and feel particularly at home in the seaside town of Playa Blanca. Ben Hillman lines up five properties for their £110,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Julie Okine and Simon Sheriff, a pair of barristers in London, aim to fulfil a long-held dream of buying a holiday home in Spain, after Julie inherited some money from her mother. With a cash budget of £100,000 in mind, Laura Hamilton shows them five very different properties along the eastern Costa del Sol

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house hunting in Northern Ireland, with Phil searching for properties in Bangor that would be suitable for Lynn, a woman who has been blind since birth. Meanwhile, Kirstie is in Belfast helping a couple of busy doctors who hope to find a home together before they tie the knot

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Across Britain, more than 600,000 buildings lie unused and unloved, and nearly a third of them are commercial. Architect George Clarke follows people as they attempt to breathe new life into these properties. First up are Cornwall couple Richard and Sarah, who bought their former local high street bank for £50,000 and now face the challenge of converting the Victorian grade II-listed building into a unique family home

programme.desc: Siobhán McSweeney hosts the grand final, with the three remaining contestants faced with two of their toughest challenges yet; - to create a stacking, pyramid vase centrepiece and a sgraffito globe. Judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller face their hardest decision yet, as they decide which potter will be crowned the winner

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Audrey and Jeff Lovelock, who dream of living in one of west London's most exclusive areas. However, the only way they can afford it is to go underground. Their plan is to transform a listed Edwardian artist's studio - along with 5,000 square feet of derelict basement - into a bespoke subterranean home, complete with supersize kitchen, mezzanine sitting room, four en-suite bedrooms, a gym, cinema, steam room and wine cellar. As if the task was not tricky enough, they are doing it without proper architects' drawings and Audrey is project managing - and the difficulties begin almost from the start

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Stavros and Emily try to get their house back from squatters, while Margaret attempts to recover the £20,000 she is owed from a letting agent, and Peterborough council find 12 people crammed into a category-one fire hazard house. programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: On the M1, Stuart Smith is forced into a 100-mile chase across several counties at up to 165mph in pursuit of an uninsured teenage joyrider in a suspected stolen car. programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.desc: Following the work of recovery crews as they trace, track and tow vehicles driven illegally on Britain's roads. With access to two recovery companies, the series follows the action from the moment they are called in, to the trucks arriving on scene, and eventually towing the vehicle away to be impounded

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A retired secretary has to visit her tenant in prison to retake possession of her buy-to-let flat. A Manchester mother applies to the housing charity Shelter for help because she is convinced the property she is renting is making her children ill

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Yorkshire police forces tackling an ever-more sophisticated criminal fraternity from the cities to the Dales. Police from the north and west of the historic county crack down on drug-addled drivers, and it is North Yorkshire's Roads Policing Group that faces the toughest challenge when a convicted drug dealer leads officers on a 140mph chase on one of the UK's busiest motorways. Jamie Theakston narrates

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: West Yorkshire officers take action against a teenage driver after he leads them on a high-speed chase across Roundhay Park in Leeds, while the cops also face a battle to keep up with uninsured drivers who flout the law without fear of consequence

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jason heads to a Christmas party that has turned into a full-blown riot, while Adam and Nick catch a drunken woman giving her daughter a lift to the shops. Plus, Kev is seconds away from disaster when he places himself in the path of danger to prevent a car from becoming a fireball

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A runaway suspect puts Gary's life in danger, Scott and Adam discover a huge stash of drugs in the boot of a car, and officers are called to a New Year's Eve pub brawl. Plus, Ady catches a car thief, and five police vehicles are involved in a motorway chase

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Scott and Dave use GPS technology to track a pair of mobile-phone thieves, and a car crashes into a house during the Christmas period. Plus, Nick pursues a criminal gang, Vicky deals with a van containing suspicious-looking scrap, and Jason contends with his own traffic nightmare

programme.title: Car Pound Cops: Give Me My Car Back!
programme.desc: Following the dramatic work of recovery crews as they trace, track and tow vehicles driven illegally on Britain's roads. With access to two recovery companies, the series follows the action from the moment they are called in, to the trucks arriving on scene, and eventually towing the vehicle away to be impounded

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: On a mission to avenge Eden, Cash operates outside the law, and refuses to hear reason - he is doing this with or without Rose's help

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Home from the hospital, Felicity is tormented by memories of the car accident. John Palmer gives Mali the royal treatment, introducing him to the Summer Bay locals

programme.title: Wetherspoons: How Do They Do It?!
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the inner workings of one of the UK's most popular pub chains, shining a light on the secrets of the brand's success. The programme explores how Wetherspoons has gained ground on its rivals by being cheaper, quicker or more responsive to customer demands, and reveals some of the tactics used to keep their customers coming back, from cheap deals on food and drink to opening their doors morning, noon and night

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: The Radford children return to education after months off due to the pandemic, and with 11-year-old Max starting at a new high school his parents anxiously wait to see how his first day went. Noel adopts a radical approach to device addiction and takes the older kids on an adventure, while Sue gets some much-needed quiet time at home with the little ones

programme.title: Rich Kids Go Skint
programme.desc: Rich Chelsea kid Olly spends time with single mum Clare, who has been driven into debt by the cost of living crisis

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Trauma team leader Julie Norton juggles two life-threatening cases who arrive at the emergency department within minutes of each other. Elsewhere, an 18-year-old is transferred from another hospital and has suffered a cardiac arrest after being stabbed in the chest with a 20cm kitchen knife

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Doctors treat a two-year-old girl with dangerously low blood-sugar levels, while 88-year-old former merchant navy man Bill is rushed in with heart and breathing problems. Elsewhere, Junior doctor Jake Mullen assesses 44-year-old Kay, who arrives at the hospital with flu-like symptoms

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: A psychological profile of the former nurse, who is currently serving 13 life sentences for murdering four children and injuring nine others at Grantham Hospital in Lincolnshire in 1991. Psychologists and criminology experts explore the possible motives for her crimes, examining her behaviour during childhood, when she was known to be an attention seeker

programme.title: Dirty Home Rescue
programme.desc: Hayley Leitch and her cleaning team go to the rescue of Joanna from Birmingham, who works two jobs and is studying for a degree, and whose flat is overflowing with possessions

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Doctors treat Angela, a teenager who is having difficulty breathing. Asthma inhalers make no difference, so doctor Caris considers the possibility that this shortness of breath could be indicative of a panic attack. Meanwhile, doctor Amir Khan meets Simon, a man with excruciating pain in his legs, and another patient receives treatment as he is suffering from problems with his hearing

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: Oscar-winning composer Findlay Crawford relies on his assistant Gabriel to do all the hard work, but the younger musician demands recognition. To protect his reputation, Findlay kills Gabriel with a time-delayed drug to give himself the perfect alibi - but the slovenly sleuth sees through his ruse. Detective drama, with Peter Falk and Billy Connolly

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A radio presenter is plotting to sabotage his adopted daughter's plans to publish her first novel and kills one of his employees for trying to help her. He thinks he has the perfect alibi, claiming that the victim was murdered while they were talking to each other on the phone, and there is a tape recording to prove it - but his ruse fails to fool the dishevelled detective. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, William Shatner and Molly Hagan

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The slovenly sleuth sets out on a pleasure cruise to Acapulco. However, one of the passengers is planning to kill his lover to stop her blackmailing him, and has arranged a cast-iron alibi. But when the crime is discovered, the captain looks to Columbo to solve the mystery. Drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Vaughn, Dean Stockwell, Patrick Macnee and Poupee Bocar

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A Californian police commissioner helps a rich, influential friend to conceal his complicity in murdering his own wife - but reckons without detective Columbo's timely intervention and his dogged determination to bring the truth to light. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Richard Kiley and Rosemary Murphy

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A CIA operative arranges a grisly fate for a fellow spy who found out that he was working as a double agent. The killer makes the murder look like a random mugging, but he is not as clever as he thinks and the crumpled cop soon begins to pick up on the trail of clues he has left behind. Crime drama, directed by and starring Patrick McGoohan, with Peter Falk and Leslie Nielsen

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A dentist with gambling debts discovers his wife is having an affair with one of his patients and wants a divorce. He plans to take revenge by poisoning the lover with his wife's heart medication, so she will be suspected - but he reckons without the attentions of the crumpled cop. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, James Read, Paul Burke, Jo Anderson and Nancy Walker

programme.title: Lucifer
programme.desc: Shocked by the death of their friend, Chloe, Lucifer and the rest of the team work together to investigate and take down the killer

programme.title: Lucifer
programme.desc: While Lucifer investigates the murder of a psychologist, Ella debates whether to open up about a childhood secret

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the rape of a teenage TV personality whose raunchy antics on and off camera had made her unpopular within the community. As events unfold, they are shocked to discover her suspected attacker may have been acting on the suggestion of a controversial DJ who had been baiting the star over the airwaves

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives are taunted by a serial killer who leaves clues about his next targets scattered around the city. Suspecting the perpetrator is emulating the crimes of a murderer active in the 1970s, they visit the one surviving victim of the original, a woman who was recently quizzed about the case by a reporter

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A magician disappears during a live-burial trick and is later found dead miles away from the location of his performance. Goren and Eames' investigation takes them deep into the mysterious world of magic as they try to unravel the conjuror's final act to identify the murderer

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A boxer celebrating a victory is killed while trying to stop a bar brawl that has spilled out onto the street. When Logan discovers he has a personal connection to the case, he and Wheeler find themselves investigating amateur boxing and uncover a world full of secrets and betrayals

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: Having rejoined the FBI ranks, Red sets his sights on capturing a science genius dubbed The Alchemist because of his ability to reconfigure DNA. programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. programme.desc: Part two of two. Vance sticks rigidly to the rules as he investigates the death of a fellow agent, but Gibbs and Franks take matters into their own hands to catch the killers. The case also leads to major changes for the agency. Drama, starring Rocky Carroll, Mark Harmon and Muse Watson

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs discovers a link between the murder of a petty officer and the break-up of his team, leading him and new director Leon Vance to uncover a case of blackmail involving an NCIS agent. The duo single out three suspects, but learn vital information has been stolen, and realise the whole Persian Gulf Fleet could be in danger

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A lieutenant apparently takes his own life by jumping from an aircraft carrier and Ziva and McGee are dispatched to inform the widow - but arrive to find that she has been killed. Subsequent inquiries reveal that the injuries on her body were inflicted after death and the murder scene was carefully staged to mislead investigators. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate the death of an heiress from an apparent drug overdose. However, the duo soon realise there is more to the case than meets the eye, as they uncover a conspiracy to kill off wealthy cancer patients so inheritors do not have to pay an estate tax

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A fatal stabbing incident leads Lupo and Bernard to the discovery that a bio-research firm has spent the past 50 years exploiting the cells of an African-American man for medical research, but has never compensated his impoverished descendants

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: When a reality TV crew goes in search of a fashion victim, they find a dead body instead. As Lupo and Bernard investigate, they begin to suspect the victim's wife - who has a violent and peculiar past - of being involved. The case is further complicated when detectives discover the facts concerning the victim's financial situation. Jeremy Sisto and Anthony Anderson star in penultimate episode of the long-running crime drama

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: New York's district attorneys investigate the mysterious death of a stockbroker who was dating the daughter of a ruthless cosmetics mogul - and find themselves caught up in a wrangle over whether HRT withdrawal can be used as a defence in law. Police drama, guest starring Lucie Arnaz, with Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston
